intro: Restio spinulosus, commonly known as the spinulose restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny white flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often covered with fine, bristly hairs. Restio spinulosus is typically found in coastal and sandy environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
